title: Inconsistent from user to user
text:
I‚Äôve been on Instagram for about 3 years, after the initial push for most of my friends. I‚Äôve found that from user to user, some get access to certain features (share post to story, for example) and others do not with no apparent rhyme or reason. The ability to contact customer support is extremely lacking, so much so that I worry if I had an issue less trivial, I might need to simply delete and create another profile to find a solution.

Targeted ads are sometimes so incognito it‚Äôs not even obvious I‚Äôve seen an ad. There‚Äôs also no way to turn this feature off or pay for the Instagram app and avoid ads altogether. Perhaps if I were paying for the service, they‚Äôd have someone available to tell me why the ability to share a post to my story goes away and comes back only to go away again and never return.

Overall, consistency in user experience is important, right? It‚Äôs why you read reviews, to get an idea of what to expect. But when my experience of the app (features available, number of ads, glitches experienced) is so vastly different than that of my friends with roughly the same number of followers, I honestly have no idea what anyone else should expect.

title: Some Thoughts On the New Layout
text:
Instagram continues to be one of my most used social media networks. It‚Äôs a very fast and fun way to connect with not just my friends, but the world as well. I enjoy the new updates, especially the one where you can select music and recommend it to your  overall following.

At the same time, I don‚Äôt necessarily care for the new layout. I find that the previous layout had less bug fixes and an easier time uploading photos onto my account. Furthermore, the previous layout looked a lot more sophisticated and made it so navigating around the app was much easier. Nowadays, it seems like there‚Äôs always one bug after another. Perhaps there could be an option where you can choose between the two previous layouts? That would be nice. Some people do like the new layout and I completely understand; to each their own. At the same time, some people (especially with multiple accounts) either have one and the other layout, or they constantly get switched to the new one automatically, making bug problems much harder to handle. Thank you. :)

text: Instagram has been my go-to app for years. It‚Äôs my favorite social media app, and I love being able to share my photography. Buuut recently, the photo quality has been lacking. Last year, when I uploaded pictures and albums, the photos were perfectly crisp and clear when I posted them. However, lately when I upload photos, the pictures become more glitchy and less clear. I did a test to see if my previous photos would still be clear if I posted them now, but alas, the previously clear pictures that I had posted turned out worse with bad quality and glitchy ness just like my recent ones. If that sounded confusing at all, please just fix the photo quality that appears after people upload photos to the app. The photo quality used to be amazing on instagram, but lately, it‚Äôs been lacking. My photos are not bad quality and have been taken on a very high-quality DSLR camera, and it‚Äôs a shame that my friends won‚Äôt be able to view the high-quality photos at their finest but instead get a meager glimpse of the now low-quality photos on the #1 best photo sharing app.

title: update and likes
text:
The UX is horrible now. It‚Äôs really frustrating going to the home page where I follow 1,500 people and it‚Äôs saying that there are no more photos and it starts showing ‚Äúsuggested posts.‚Äù I don‚Äôt care about suggested posts. I care about my friends. I want to see what they‚Äôre up to and how their lives are. 

Also, Instagram is NOT a shopping app for us photo lovers. We want to share pictures and moments‚Ä¶ we don‚Äôt want to shop. Having this shopping page tab in the main bar demonstrates that you all care more about money than your users. A better choice would be to change the bottom bar back to normal and add the shopping icon and reels icon to the top right where the notification and post buttons are. It would make more sense from a graphic design perspective. Hierarchy of importance ‚Äî the main tab should consist of your post button, your Home Screen, your profile, your notifications, and your search button. Reels, shopping, and other ads-ons (such as the story button) should be on the top bar. 

Above all, please consider changing the Home Screen feed back to just people that I follow. No one wants to go to the Home Screen and see random content ‚Äî they follow people for a reason.

title: New picture messaging feature needs work
text: Instagram hasn't changed that much in the years I've used it but recently they've introduced a Snapchat like feature where you can send picture messages with text, basically the same thing as Snapchat. I like the Instagram system better though, because the messaging interface has a feature whereby you can incorporate someone's picture message into your reply. It appears as a little thumbnail version of the image they sent you, kind of like the little thumbnail you see when you're facetiming someone. This is really a great feature because it helps to organize the conversation and that way you can remember what is being said. Sadly the system has a really annoying bug that is seemingly completely random in its timing. The issue is pretty simple: a lot of times the text that you write on the picture doesn't appear on the other persons screen when they receive the message. So basically there is no message. This happens usually when replying and incorporating the other persons image into your own but it also happens on standalone messages. Very very annoying and has killed many conversations. I really hope this gets fixed because if it does I'll pretty much ditch Snapchat altogether.

title: Monopolistic garbage
text:
The only reason instagram still had a big user base is due to network effects.

The fact that you can‚Äôt schedule posts, a very basic feature, is absurd, and the fact that only business users (not personal users nor creators) can auto post with third party apps is ridiculous. It‚Äôs as if it didn‚Äôt occur to instagram that users who have accounts for pleasure or for fun would want control of when or how they post. And there‚Äôs no justification why creators can‚Äôt auto post. I had resisted instagram for a while, but had decided to create a hobby page on instagram. But I was so incredibly frustrated by trying to get third party app to schedule posts (I had to set my account to a business account, create a Facebook account, Facebook then blocked my account for no reason), that I had to drop the project altogether.

The app is so user unfriendly that I‚Äôm amazed it still has a user base. It‚Äôs clear as time passes, more and more young people will select other apps, as instagram intentionally makes its app user unfriendly. It makes me think that Meta needs to think long and hard about their strategy, as alienating potential users is not going to help the fact that they‚Äôre struggling to increase their user base.
